page.title: 04Margam Park. Landscapes
page.content: Within Margam Park is a landscape unique in the valleys and hills of South Wales. Barren uplands contrast sharply with the rolling parkland to the south of Craig Y Lodge that is reminiscent of the estates of lowland England. Little within the park is natural, the plant habitats the result of agricultural management and landscape planting. Broad leaved, coniferous and mixed woodland, grassland, lakes and streams provides a landscape which contrasts vividly with industrial Port Talbot. Of the 840 acres of the park, 110 are wooded. Some ancient sweet chestnuts and oaks remain on Mynydd y Castell but most woodland has been planted to enhance the landscape. Conifers especially Scots pine are abundant.
